description.message: Add customized infinite scrolling to websites and auto load the next page. Supports the AutoPagerize Database. (Beta)

install_dialog_title.message: Thank You for Adding Infy Scroll

install_dialog_know.message: Before getting started, there's a few things you should know...

install_dialog_list_1.message: Infy is currently in beta. Unfortunately, this means it might not work on every website you try it on

install_dialog_list_2.message: Infy is already set to auto-activate on many websites. If you don't want it to, you can uncheck Auto-Activate under the Database Options

install_dialog_toolbar_message.message: Also, if you don't see Infy's Icon in your Browser's Toolbar,

install_dialog_toolbar_chrome.message: click the "Puzzle Piece Icon" from your Toolbar so you can pin it.

install_dialog_toolbar_edge.message: click the "Browser Menu" from your Toolbar so you can pin it.

install_dialog_toolbar_firefox.message: click "Menu > Customize" from your Toolbar so you can pin it.

install_dialog_email_message.message: Lastly, I want you to be 100% happy with Infy! If something isn't working, please don't hesitate to email me for help:

bugs_warning.message: ... You still sure? It may contain bugs!

scroll_append_page_description.message: Appends the full page as is, but may break HTML or images

scroll_append_iframe_description.message: Appends the full page in an iframe so HTML or images won't break

scroll_append_element_description.message: Appends specific elements on the page for seamless scrolling

scroll_append_media_description.message: For sequential URLs that point directly to media (like "001.jpg")

scroll_append_none_description.message: Infy won't append anything after performing this action

scroll_append_keep_description.message: Tries to keep specific elements on the page from being replaced

scroll_wrap_first_page_label.message: Wrap Page 1 in an iframe for maximum unbreakability

scroll_height_wait_tooltip.message: This setting will force Infy to wait the specified milliseconds before calculating the final height of the iframe (in case some dynamic content hasn't finished loading). You may wish to change this value on certain websites. For example, if you notice that the pages are too short (content appears cropped), increase the wait. If the pages are too tall (extra empty space), decrease the wait. A good value to try first is 3000 ms.

scroll_element_rule_tooltip.message: This rule targets specific elements on the page that you want appended. For example, if the elements are inside a table (the table's rows), your Page Element Rule could be a CSS Selector like table tr or an XPath like //table//tr

scroll_element_insert_rule_tooltip.message: This rule is optional and rarely used. It lets you adjust the insertion point of the page element to come before footers or paginated dividers to help keep them out of view.

scroll_element_iframe_tooltip.message: Enabling this is like having a hybrid of both Iframe and Element modes. Instead of appending the elements as is, this will append them in an iframe to help prevent HTML or images from breaking while in Element mode.

error_skip_tooltip.message: This checks if the next URL will return an HTTP error code (like 404) and increments again, skipping it up to 100 times until it finds the next good URL. Note that some websites may choose to not return an error code. You may notice a few seconds delay when error skipping. Set to 0 to disable it.

base_date_tooltip.message: View Help Guide for Date Formats

base_custom_tooltip.message: View Help Guide for Custom Bases

iframes_not_supported_error.message: Infy can't append Iframes on this website, most likely because this website set its 'X-Frame-Options' to 'deny'.

off_button_title.message: Turn off (Click ACCEPT to turn back on)

save_url_regex_icon_title.message: This is a Saved URL (Regular Expression)

popup_activated_snackbar_label.message: Heads up! Infy is already activated and you might not be able to make major changes (like changing the Append Mode) until you refresh the page.

popup_activated_also_snackbar_label.message: Also, this is a ?; to keep Infy from auto-activating after refreshing, you might need to first click the Red Turn Off Button

popup_found_snackbar_label.message: Infy found a ? that matches this URL and was able to pre-configure it for you

save_url_type_exact_tooltip.message: Save an Exact URL when using the Increment URL action and if you manually changed the default selection to increment or if you only wanted to match this exact (single) URL

save_url_type_pattern_tooltip.message: Saving a Pattern lets you match multiple URLs easily in two ways: 1) as a "Substring" of them or 2) as "Wildcards." For example, you could save a "Substring Pattern" like www.example.com/pictures/ to match all urls that have www.example.com/pictures/ in them as a substring. If you include at least one * character, your pattern will be treated as a "Wildcard." For example, you could save a "Wildcard Pattern" like *www.example.com/*/* to match both https://www.example.com/pictures/ and https://www.example.com/videos/

save_url_type_regex_tooltip.message: Save a Regular Expression for more fine-tuned matching via regex syntax. Important: When entering Regular Expressions, you must escape (prepend) the following special characters with a backslash character '\' if you want to match them literally: . ? \ ^ $ * + | ( ) [ ] { } Example: ^https?://www\.example\.com/.*/

save_instructions.message: Saving this URL will allow Infy to auto-activate the next time you visit using the settings you set here.

save_url_help_title.message: How To Save a URL Correctly:

save_url_help_content.message: In most cases, you can pick Pattern and shorten the URL so that it matches multiple URLs that are similar. (If you know regex syntax, you can select Regular Expression instead.) Select Exact if using the Increment URL mode and if you manually changed the selection or if you wanted Infy to only activate on this exact (single) URL.

save_url_example_content.message: If you wanted Infy to activate on all google search pages (no matter what your search term is), then select the Pattern option and shorten the URL to only contain the common characters that are in all google search URLs e.g. https://www.google.com/search (trimming off all the characters that appear after "search")

save_dialog_notice.message: Click YES and ACCEPT to finalize saving the URL or click NO and ACCEPT to delete it

scripts_and_styles_dialog_instructions.message: Infy can append each page's scripts and styles and fix lazy loading to help fix broken HTML or missing images. You normally don't need to enable these settings, but they may help on some websites.

scripts_and_styles_dialog_help_title.message: Help! Which Setting Should I Try First?

scripts_and_styles_dialog_help_content.message: If the Fix Lazy Loading option isn't helping, uncheck it and try the Append Scripts option to see if it fixes the issue. The Append Styles option is rarely needed and is more likely to cause issues, so only try it if you think the page has styling issues. If none of the settings help, you should consider changing the Append mode to Iframe (or Element Iframe), as that will force each page to append its scripts and styles in an isolated environment.

scripts_and_styles_dialog_notice.message: Note: These settings will apply starting with the next page that gets appended

scripts_and_styles_dialog_warning.message: Warning: These settings may be removed in the future

scroll_append_scripts_tooltip.message: Heads Up! This feature will append each page's scripts and may help fix missing images or broken HTML. However, it may need to be removed in Chrome Manifest v3 due to its restriction on extensions injecting script tags

scroll_append_styles_tooltip.message: Heads Up! This feature is rarely, if ever, needed. Only check it as a last resort, as most websites should not have CSS-specific styles for similar pages

scroll_append_custom_styles_label.message: Append my own custom styles for each page (CSS)

scroll_append_custom_styles_text_field_h.message: Example: footer { display: none !important; } img { width: 200px; }

scroll_lazy_load_attribute_source_toolti.message: This is the attribute of the element that has the URL of the media. It's typically 'data-src' or a 'data-*' attribute. Inspect the elements using your browser to find out which one it is.

scroll_lazy_load_attribute_destination_t.message: This is the attribute of the element that you want to set. For images and other media, this is almost always 'src'. Need to set the background-image instead? Simply enter 'style.background-image' (without the quotation marks) and Infy will know what to do.

next_prev_url_not_right.message: Not quite right? Try adjusting the rule or keywords (Options) or switch to another action

increment_header_text.message: Select the part of the URL to Increment or

decrement_tooltip.message: To decrement, enter a negative interval like -1

multi_button_tooltip.message: Multi Incrementing - Click to increment up to 3 parts of the URL simultaneously or in ranges. See the Help Guide for more information.

button_details.message: This action is for handling pesky AJAX and SPA websites. Infy can click a "Load More" button as you scroll down the page and perform no appending, letting the website append content. Infy will click the button each time you've scrolled to its position.

list_header_text.message: Enter a custom list of URLs

list_text_field_helper_line.message: URLs must be separated by line breaks, have the same domain, and start with a protocol

list_description.message: Infy can append a series of pages based on your own custom list of URLs. Please make sure that all URLs begin with a protocol like https:// and that they belong to the same domain of the page you are currently on:

list_domain_tooltip.message: This is the domain/origin of the page you are currently on. Please make sure that all URLs belong to this domain. Infy can't append pages from other domains due to the CORS Policy enforced by your browser

auto_slideshow_tooltip.message: Slideshow Mode will have Infy slide down to each page for you automatically and repeat

next_prev_result_message_success.message: A ? Link was found using the

next_prev_result_message_error.message: A ? Link wasn't found. Try another action or adjust the

scroll_element_result_message_error.message: No elements were found. Try adjusting the

scroll_element_result_tooltip_success.message: The parent element's tag is ?1 and the insertion point is going to be ?2

button_result_message_success.message: The button was found using the

button_result_message_error.message: The button wasn't found. Try adjusting the

button_result_tooltip_success.message: The button's tag name is ? and it is clickable

button_result_tooltip_error_clickable.message: The rule returned an element, but it wasn't clickable

no_result_tooltip_error.message: The Selector or XPath rule looks to be valid but it didn't return anything. Please double-check the rule in your browser's console and try it again

save_url_error.message: In order to save a URL, please enter a URL to save or un-toggle the Heart Button

save_type_error.message: In order to save a URL, please select a save type (like Pattern) or un-toggle the Heart Button

scroll_append_media_action_error.message: Append Media mode requires a sequence of URLs and can only be used with the Increment URL or URL List actions. Try changing to the appropriate action

scroll_append_keep_error.message: Append Keep mode is coming in a future update! Please try another action or append mode in the mean time

next_prev_empty_error.message: Infy needs a Next/Prev Link in order to continue; please adjust the rule or switch to another action

selection_notalphanumeric_error.message: Select only alphanumeric characters or adjust the base type to match the selection

selection_notinurl_error.message: Selection has to be a part of the URL

selection_toolarge_error.message: Selection is too large; please select a smaller number or fewer characters

selection_base_error.message: Select only numbers or a higher base type to match characters in selection

selectionstart_invalid_error.message: Selection position must be from URL

interval_invalid_error.message: Interval has to be between -9007199254740991 and 9007199254740991

error_skip_invalid_error.message: Error Skip has to be between 0 and 100

base_date_invalid_error.message: Date format doesn't match selection. Try viewing the help guide for examples

base_roman_invalid_error.message: A roman numeral couldn't be parsed from the selection (Latin is for upper and lower case; U216 and U217 are unicode)

base_decimal_invalid_error.message: A decimal number (in the format of #.# like "1.5") could not be parsed from the selection

base_custom_invalid_error.message: Custom base couldn't be validated against selection. There may be characters in your selection that aren't in the custom base's alphabet. Try viewing the help guide for examples

multi_count_error.message: To multi-increment, select at least two selections in the URL

multi_save_error.message: Can't Save a URL if Multi-Incrementing is enabled due to complexity; please un-toggle either the Save Heart or Multi-Incrementing Buttons (+ + +)

button_scroll_pixels_error.message: Button Position should be between 0 and 10,000 Pixels

button_auto_slideshow_error.message: Can't use Auto Slideshow mode with the Click Button action

list_blank_error.message: Your URL List can't be blank

list_newline_error.message: Your URL List should have at least two URLs separated by line breaks

auto_times_invalid_error.message: Auto Times has to be between 1 and 1000

auto_seconds_invalid_error.message: Auto Seconds has to be between 1 and 3600

local_url_append_error.message: This looks like a Local file:// URL and Infy can't use the Append Mode you selected due to CORS. Please change it to Media or None (Button)

popup_error_message.message: Oops — Sorry! Infy had trouble loading on this page. Infy might not have permission to work on this page (for example: Browser Pages, Options Page, or New Tab Page), or you might need to try refreshing this page again. If that doesn't work, you might need to try resetting your Options (About section).

popup_error_reason_chrome.message: Chrome is undefined! This indicates a severe error as chrome is the base object in the Extension API.

popup_error_reason_instance.message: Infy's content script couldn't load. This usually means you just need to refresh this page again. In some cases, Infy's storage may be corrupted and you might need to reset your Options (About section). If it's still not working, you might have an extension that is interfering with Infy or you might need to reinstall Infy.

popup_error_reason_items.message: Infy's storage items are corrupt! This indicates a severe error with your Options as the extension can't work without settings. Please try resetting your Options (About section).

popup_error_help.message: Help is right around the corner! Click Help to get personal assistance.

ui_settings_description.message: Jazz it up and change the look and feel of the UI.

state_tooltip.message: This is Infy's current "global" on/off state. When it is off, it will not auto-activate on Saved URLs or Database URLs. This setting automatically adjusts each time you either click the "ACCEPT" or the "Red Turn Off" Buttons in Infy's Window to turn it on or off, respectively. This setting is only provided in the Options in the extremely unlikely event that you need to control it here instead.

interface_image_disclaimer.message: Important: In order to provide you with a more functional UI (and enhancements, like a Dark Theme), the "UI Image" option may be going away and "Infy" may no longer be a selectable option in future versions. Infy will always remain visible in the Options and elsewhere. Thank you for understanding

interface_theme_checkbox_label.message: Show the Version 0.6 Starry Night theme in the UI

interface_messages_checkbox_label.message: Show persistent messages in the UI, such as if Infy is already activated

dynamic_settings_tooltip.message: This lets Infy remember the last-used Action and Append Mode you set in the UI as the new default (except on Database URLs). Most users will find this feature to be convenient because Infy will always pre-select the last setting you chose. The only reason to disable this is if you use the Whitelist or Down shortcut command to auto-activate Infy so that they always perform the same default action and append mode (for example, Next Link and Page).

dynamic_settings_checkbox_label.message: Remember the last-used UI setting as the new default setting

dynamic_settings_current.message: The current default action and append mode settings are:

dynamic_settings_change.message: To change these settings, check the Dynamic Settings checkbox, open Infy's window on a non-Database URL, and click ACCEPT. If you want to make the new defaults stick, uncheck the Dynamic Settings checkbox afterwards.

saved_urls_settings_description.message: Save your own URLs — each with their own custom infinite scroll settings — and have Infy auto-activate the next time you visit them. You can save URLs by clicking the Heart Button in the top-right corner of Infy's Window. To keep your data as private as possible, Infy only saves URLs locally onto your device — not in the cloud.

saved_urls_none.message: ... Aw! You don't have any Saved URLs yet.

saved_urls_click_details.message: Click on the Saved URLs for more details

whitelist_enable_label.message: Use a Whitelist to quickly save a list of URLs (uses the default infinite scroll settings)

whitelist_explanation.message: Don't need to save each URL individually with its own settings? You can enter a "whitelist" of URLs here and Infy will auto-activate when you visit them using the default infinite scroll (action and append) settings. Just remember to uncheck the "Dynamic Settings" checkbox in the UI section so that the default settings never change.

whitelist_textarea.message: Enter a list of URLs or URL patterns separated by commas, spaces, or line breaks.

whitelist_text_field_helper_text.message: Please separate URLs by line breaks. If using Regular Expressions, surround them with / characters. If entering Exact URLs, surround them with " characters. Everything else is treated as a Pattern (that is, either a Substring or a Wildcard with * characters). See the Help Guide for more information. Examples:

database_whitelist_blacklist_text_field_.message: Please separate URLs by line breaks. If using Regular Expressions, surround them with / characters. If entering Exact URLs, surround them with " characters. If matching Database URLs, surround them with ( ) characters. Everything else is treated as a Pattern (that is, either a Substring or a Wildcard with * characters). See the Help Guide for more information. Examples:

database_settings_description_2.message: to setup infinite scrolling for thousands of websites for you automagically. You can either have Infy auto-activate on all Database URLs by default (and disallow some via a blacklist) or not auto-activate by default (but allow some via a whitelist). This is controlled by the "Auto-activate on all Database URLs" checkbox below.

database_settings_help_link.message: The AutoPagerize Database is hosted on Wedata.net

database_settings_help_1.message: and is maintained and updated by users just like you! Please consider contributing to the database and give back to the community so we all can benefit from one another. Learn more about how to contribute in the Help Guide.

database_disclaimer.message: Important: Have an AutoPagerize-type extension installed? If so, please make sure to either delete the Database or uncheck "Auto-activate on all Database URLs" so that Infy doesn't activate itself along with AP. You can still use the AutoPagerize extension for Database URLs and use Infy for all other URLs.

database_auto_update_tooltip.message: This will keep your copy of the AutoPagerize Database auto-updated and keep websites' infinite scroll settings up to date. Infy will check and re-download the database if it has been more than the number of days since the last download. It's recommended to set this to 1 or 2 Days as websites can change their design at any time. Set to 0 to disable auto-updating.

database_snackbar_download_error_label.message: Oops! Could not download database from

shortcuts_description.message: Pfft... just scrolling? Infy supports shortcuts too! There's shortcuts for the following actions: Down one page, Up one page, Turn off, and Auto pause or resume. When you press the Down shortcut command, Infy will conveniently turn on and auto-activate itself using the default infinite scroll settings if it hasn't been activated yet. Just remember to uncheck the "Dynamic Settings" checkbox in the UI section so that the default settings never change.

shortcuts_dialog_description.message: To configure your browser's extension shortcuts:

shortcuts_dialog_disclaimer.message: Important: Your browser may change these steps in the future

scroll_settings_description.message: These settings affect how Infy works behind the scenes while you scroll and pages are being appended. Some of these settings are a little technical, so if you make a mistake, you can click the Reset Options button in the About section to return to the default values.

scroll_detection_tooltip.message: This is the API Infy uses to detect your current scroll position on the page. Scroll Listener will use more CPU, but will be more accurate in determining when a page should be appended. Intersection Observer is a newer API that will use less CPU, but will be less accurate. Infy's Scroll Listener is carefully throttled to not use too much CPU; however, if you want to be ultra-conservative on your device's battery life or want to try some newer tech, please feel free to try using the newer IO API instead.

scroll_detection_throttle_tooltip.message: When using its Scroll Listener, Infy will throttle it so it won't use too much CPU to calculate your current scroll position. Lower ms (Less Throttled) = More CPU. Higher ms (More Throttled) = Less CPU. A throttle of about 200-500 ms is reasonably OK.

scroll_behavior_tooltip.message: Whenever you tell Infy to scroll to a page by pressing a button or by entering a shortcut, it can either scroll to the page instantly or smoothly. (This has no effect on how you scroll.)

scroll_update_tooltip.message: As you scroll, Infy can update the address bar and tab title to reflect the actual URL and title of the current page you are viewing. It's important to note that updating the address bar will add the URL to your browsing history (except when browsing in Incognito/Private Mode), and you may wish to disable this if you want to keep your history minimal. Note that the address bar can't be updated when viewing local files.

scroll_append_threshold_tooltip.message: This affects how soon in advance Infy should start requesting a new page to append based on your scroll position. For example, a value of 500 pixels means Infy won't start to append a new page until you've scrolled to within 500 pixels of the bottom. For most websites, you should keep this setting at around 500-1000 pixels for performance/efficiency reasons. Note: If you are using Intersection Observer, the threshold metric is in pages, not pixels — in other words, how many pages you are away from the last page.

scroll_append_delay_tooltip.message: In order to not overburden a website's server, Infy adds a small delay after appending a page and before it is allowed to request the next page. A value of 2000 ms (2 seconds) is about right for most websites and is the lowest you should typically set this to. (In Auto mode, the Append Delay is replaced with the Auto Seconds set.)

scroll_overlay_checkbox_label.message: Show an overlay with the current page number in the top right

scroll_icon_checkbox_label.message: Show an infinity icon inside the page divider and overlay (so you know it's Infy!)

scroll_loading_checkbox_label.message: Show an infinity animation when Infy is loading on the bottom

next_prev_settings_description.message: This is a small glimpse into Infy's brains and is what allows it to find the next or prev link on most websites. Infy's algorithm first attempts to use the Selector or XPath rule and then falls back to parsing the entire page's links for common keywords. You probably won't need to tinker with these settings; however, feel free to change the default rule type to your preference (Selector or XPath) and add in any extra next/prev keywords for your favorite sites. If you make a mistake, you can click the Reset Options button in the About section.

property_tooltip.message: This is the DOM property of the element, like href for anchors. Nested properties (separated by periods) can also be entered, so you can enter complex things like parentNode.href to target the parent node's href instead. To use data-* attributes like data-src, you can enter the property as dataset.src

next_keywords_enabled_label.message: Look for links using Keywords if the Next Rule fails

prev_keywords_enabled_label.message: Look for links using Keywords if the Prev Rule fails

keywords_text_field_helper_line.message: Keywords are ordered in priority, separated by commas, all lowercase, and should not contain spaces

increment_decrement_settings_description.message: Infy uses the same code base as the URL Incrementer extension, so you get the top-of-the-line incrementing experience! That said, you probably won't feel the need to change any of these settings. They exist because Infy was primarily designed to support scroll incrementing.

selection_option_smart.message: Select numbers like "page=1" in the URL

selection_option_lastnumber.message: Select the last number in the URL

selection_option_firstnumber.message: Select the first number in the URL

selection_custom_url_label.message: Test URL String (Required, note this is saved)

selection_custom_help_label.message: For more testing and help, please use

selection_custom_matchgroup_error.message: Match found, but not in group entered

selection_custom_matchindex_error.message: Match found, but not in index entered

selection_custom_matchnotvalid_error.message: couldn't be validated against selection and current base (try adjusting index)

shuffle_limit_tooltip.message: The shuffle limit affects the range of URLs that you will see when you have shuffle enabled. For example, a value of 100 means that, if you start at page=1, the next URLs you will see will only be in the range of 2-101. Increase or decrease the limit to change the range.

extra_settings_description.message: These additional settings, while seemingly unimportant, can drastically change how Infy works. Note: These settings are non-invasive and only take effect on pages where Infy is activated (in other words, only whenever you see that Infy is turned "ON").

custom_scripts_enable_label.message: Enable Infy's Custom Scripts (Fixes missing images for popular websites, like Google Search)

scroll_lazy_load_enable_label.message: Automatically try to fix lazily loaded images (Recommended)

resize_media_enable_label.message: Resize images and media that are bigger than the window (Recommended)

links_new_tab_enable_label.message: Open links in a new tab when clicking on them

custom_events_enable_label.message: Trigger JavaScript Custom Events when appending or performing other actions (See Help Guide for details)

decode_uri_enable_label.message: Decode URLs so that all non-ASCII (non-English) characters are shown literally and not percent encoded

debug_enable_label.message: Enable Debug Mode (Icon feedback, next/prev element highlighting)

reset_options_disclaimer.message: Does not reset your Saved URLs

reset_options_dialog_description.message: Are you sure you want to reset your options to the default values? (This will not reset your Saved URLs.)

thank_you_rainbow.message: Thank you so much for using Infy Scroll

thank_you_wish.message: I want you to be 100% happy with Infy, so please email me if there are any issues. Infy loves scrolling with you and wishes you a Scrollful Day and Starry Night!

credits_you.message: ... and most of all you for using Infy
